description: Students focus on the nursing care of childbearing and childrearing families in the context of family-centered care. Family theory will be utilized as the framework for nursing assessment and care of families in various situations across the lifespan. Clinical experiences are provided with childbearing and childrearing families. Counts toward the nursing major. Offered annually in the fall semester beginning fall 2019. Prerequisite: open to senior nursing majors only; NURS 211; concurrent registration in NURS 315 and NURS 316.
name: Family Health
prerequisites: open to senior nursing majors only; NURS 211; concurrent registration in NURS 315 and NURS 316.
